messages.message: @ayesha.ali do you want to huddle on this IRL in NYC today, if you're coming in?
might be easiest to chat through for a sec!
oo can I join too, I also have thoughts (and will be commuting over soon)
In which case, maybe we could also go over this open question. linked thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C0976HB6ZPT/p1758030338130379?thread_ts=1757964886.250579&cid=C0976HB6ZPT)

Yes.. I was just catching up with @lydia and to further complicate this convo Anant and Sumita do not want extended support timelines for Agent Mode. So maybe we white board this out from first principles!
Yep that would be super helpful! Omw to the office rn

Updates to AI Runtime handling per convo with @ayesha.ali and @pauline.comising:

Key update: We do not want to introduce extended support timelines, per feedback from leadership. But we do still want to introduce behavior change for "automated upgrades"

• Naming convention: we will still go with 2.x naming
• We won’t support additional releases to the 1.x path after 2.0 - 
• We will maintain current app/runtime behavior in accuracy runs - i.e. we will deprecate the toggle in app runs to choose processing mode
• Introduce discussed behavior change for apps on “automated upgrades”. All apps will basically be treated as "when expired", meaning they'll be auto-upgraded to agent mode on current support timeframe:
    ◦ 1 mo - commercial
    ◦ 6 mos - enterprise
• Given shortened upgrade timelines, include extra time for regression testing in project plan
• Incorporate this identified improvement (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-4586?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiOWJhNGIwZDFjZmM2NGMzZjljMmFmNjczMTRjMTA1YTkiLCJwIjoiamlyYS1zbGFjay1pbnQifQ) to AI Runtime behavior to honor support window starting _when the new version is released_
• Maintain the “update runtime in place” functionality - reduces overhead for deployments/eventually workflows
cc: @Anil @lydia @Serena @melissa.amos

@pauline.comising @ayesha.ali also noting the addl requirements that came out of our sync on friday:
• add reqs to propegate project setting to an app
• "retro-fitting" agent mode for ai runtime
• gating agent mode on feat flag - since we will need to org feat flag this

pauline and i did some investigation and it looks like for that improvement ticket, the desired behavior is acc in the platform (i.e. expiration date of 1.0.x is the release version of 1.0.x+1 + appropriate expiry window). there is a potential bug w/ how the maintain app behavior GA release version is impacting expiration dates currently, which is a separate ticket, but will be included in this work

> there is a potential bug w/ how the maintain app behavior GA release version is impacting expiration dates currently, which is a separate ticket, but will be included in this work
can you explain the bug more? We did add logic that the expiration window shouldn't start until the GA release version, so that AI runtimes that were released before we GA'ed maintain app behavior wouldn't immediately be expired. This is because we shipped AI runtime app freezing a few releases before we GA'ed the UI flow. So you can imagine if we didn't have this logic, older runtimes might already show as expired the moment the AI runtime UI flow appeared.
